DOCNAME: CASE OF JANOS TOTH v. HUNGARY
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . NORP In or about DATE the applicant and his wife brought an action against several respondents before ORG , seeking ownership of a real estate and protection against trespass .
CARDINAL . ORG held numerous hearings DATE and DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG delivered a partial judgment , dismissing the plaintiffs’ claim for protection against trespass . This decision was upheld on appeal by ORG on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG appointed an expert who filed an opinion on DATE .
CARDINAL . The final first - instance judgment was delivered on DATE . On appeal , ORG decided the case on DATE .
CARDINAL . The applicant lodged a petition for review with ORG . It quashed the previous judgments and remitted the case to the first - instance on DATE .

CARDINAL . In the resumed proceedings the applicant notified the domestic courts that CARDINAL of the respondents had died on DATE . On DATE ORG thus established that the review proceedings had been discontinued on this account , and annulled its previous judgment of DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) . DATE , ORG remitted the case to the first - instance .
CARDINAL . DATE the proceedings were stalled because the applicant did not cooperate with a court - appointed expert .
CARDINAL . On DATE the case was transferred to ORG , due to bias of the judges at ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the latter court delivered a partial judgment . On CARDINAL DATE ORG held a hearing on appeal . It appears from the documents available in the case file that the case is still pending before ORG .
